model

Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Node

  • public class Node
extends java.lang.Object
    The class Node represents a valid position for a piece on the game board.
    Node provides similar usage to that of Piece objects but each node also includes a list of connections

    • Constructor Detail

      • Node

        public Node(int position,
            int x,
            int y,
            java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> joints)
        Parameters:
        position - location on board using clockwise grid starting at top left and going from outer to inner frame
        x - coordinate of the node in respect to the window (column)
        y - coordinate of the node in respect to the window (row)
        joints - list of nodes this Node is connected to

      • Node

        public Node(int position,
            int x,
            int y,
            int[] coordinates)
        Parameters:
        position - location on board using clockwise grid starting at top left and going from outer to inner frame
        x - coordinate of the node in respect to the window (column)
        y - coordinate of the node in respect to the window (row)
        coordinates - position on the board with respect to Piece coordinate system

      • Node

        public Node(int position,
            int x,
            int y)
        Parameters:
        position - position location on board using clockwise grid starting at top left and going from outer to inner frame
        x - coordinate of the node in respect to the window (column)
        y - coordinate of the node in respect to the window (row)

        public static boolean isConnected(Node first,
                                  Node second)
        Checks if two Nodes are connected
        Parameters:
        first - Node to be checked
        second - Node to be checked against
        Returns:
        true is the Nodes are connected, otherwise false
